file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-70-00-04 - DOOR WARNING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL DOOR WARNING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to deactivate and reactivate the door warning system (door position indication on the MFD and EICAS) of the fueling door, access hatches, or emergency access hatches. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY DOOR WARNING - DEACTIVATION PRO- ALL 52-70-00-040-801-A CEDURE DOOR WARNING - REACTIVATION PRO- ALL 52-70-00-440-801-A CEDURE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-70-00 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-70-00-040-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. DOOR WARNING - DEACTIVATION PROCEDURE A. General (1) This task is applicable to item 52-70-00 Door Warning System (Door Position Indication on the MFD and EICAS). (2) This procedure gives the instructions to deactivate the door warning system (door position indication on the MFD and EICAS) of the fueling door, access hatches, or emergency access hatches. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the main door H. Deactivation Procedure SUBTASK 040-002-A (1) (On ANAC- and IAC-AR-certified aircraft) It is permitted to dispatch the aircraft with the door warning system (door position indication on the MFD and EICAS) of the fueling door, access hatches, or emergency access hatches inoperative if you make sure before each departure that the hatches are closed and latched. (2) (On FAA-certified aircraft) It is permitted to dispatch the aircraft with the door warning system (door position indication on the MFD and EICAS) of the fueling door, access hatches, or emergency access hatches inoperative if you make sure before each departure that the hatches are closed and latched and the master warning system operates normally for the remaining doors. (3) Before each departure, do a careful check to make sure that the fueling door, access hatches, or emergency access hatches are locked or latched. (4) Attach an "AFFECTED DOOR WARNING IND. INOP" placard to the MFD or EICAS bezel. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 52-70-00 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (5) Write in the aircraft technical logbook that you did the procedure for deactivation of the Door Warning System. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 52-70-00 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-70-00-440-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. DOOR WARNING - REACTIVATION PROCEDURE A. General (1) This task is applicable to item 52-70-00 Door Warning System (Door Position Indication on MFD and EICAS). (2) This procedure gives the instructions to reactivate the door warning system (door position indication on the MFD and EICAS) of the fueling door, access hatches, or emergency access hatches. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION FORWARD ELECTRONIC-COMPARTMENT-DOOR AMM TASK 52-71-00-700-801-A/500 WARNING - OPERATIONAL CHECK COCKPIT UNDERFLOOR ACCESS HATCH WARN- AMM TASK 52-72-00-700-801-A/500 ING - OPERATIONAL CHECK PASSENGER - CABIN ESCAPE - HATCH CAUTION AMM TASK 52-75-01-700-801-A/500 MICROSWITCHES - OPERATIONAL TEST REAR - ELECTRONIC - COMPARTMENT ACCESS AMM TASK 52-77-01-700-801-A/500 HATCH CAUTION MICROSWITCH -OPERATIONAL TEST FUELING CONTROL PANEL AND PRESSURE REFU- AMM TASK 52-78-00-700-801-A/500 ELING ADAPTER ACCESS DOOR CAUTION MES- SAGE - OPERATIONAL TEST C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the main door EMB-145 - AMM 1285 440-801-A/400 52-70-00 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Reactivation Procedure SUBTASK 440-002-A (1) Do a functional check of the microswitch. If it is not serviceable, replace the microswitch. (2) Adjust the microswitch of the fueling door ( AMM TASK 52-78-00-700-801-A/500), access hatches ( AMM TASK 52-77-01-700-801-A/500, AMM TASK 52-72-00-700-801-A/500, or AMM TASK 52-71-00-700-801-A/500) or emergency access hatches ( AMM TASK 52-75-01-700-801-A/500). (3) Remove the "AFFECTED DOOR WARNING IND. INOP" placard from the MFD or EICAS bezel. (4) Write in the aircraft technical logbook that you did the procedure for reactivation of the Door Warning System. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 440-801-A/400 52-70-00 Page 5 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
